data.title: Valve Industry Trade Associations
data.meta_description: Val-Matic is a member/partner/affiliate of several valve industry trade associations. Find the list here.
data.text:
American Petroleum Institute

The American Petroleum Institute (API) traces its beginning to World War I, when Congress and the domestic oil and natural gas industry worked together to help the war effort. The American Petroleum Institute (API) is the only national trade association that represents all aspects of America’s oil and natural gas industry. Val-Matic’s QuadroSphere® Trunnion-Mounted Ball Valve complies with API standards.

www.api.org

American Society of Sanitary Engineering

The American Society of Sanitary Engineering (ASSE) is a nonprofit organization that is comprised of individual and sustaining members who represent all disciplines of the Plumbing Industry. Its mission is to, in the spirit of its motto "Prevention Rather Than Cure," continually improve the performance, reliability and safety of plumbing systems. Val-Matic is a member company of ASSE and assisted with writing the ASSE 1063 Standard on Inflow Preventers, to which the FloodSafe® is listed.

www.asse-plumbing.org

American Water Works Association

The American Water Works Association (AWWA) is an internationally recognized authority on drinking water issues. Val-Matic is an active participant on several AWWA Valve Standards Committees and has been instrumental in publishing related Standards and Manuals of Practice. John Holstrom and John Ballun currently serve as Chairs of several valve sub-committees.

www.awwa.org

Manufacturers Standardization Society

The Manufacturers Standardization Society's (MSS) primary function is to provide its members the means to develop engineering standard practices for the use and benefit of the industry and users of its products. The Society, the only organization dedicated solely to the technical needs of the industry, is currently comprised of 25 technical committees to write, revise and reaffirm industry standards. Steve Dalton and Jim Gower are active participants on several MSS Standards Committees and have been instrumental in publishing valve MSS Standards of Practice. John Ballun, P.E. is a Past President of MSS.

mss-hq.org

Submersible Wastewater Pump Association

The Submersible Wastewater Pump Association (SWPA) is a national trade association representing and serving the manufacturers of submersible pumps for municipal and industrial wastewater pump applications. Diane Meyer is a current member of the SWPA Executive Committee. Val-Matic is an associate member and regular contributor to SWPA’s Lift Station Design Handbook.

www.swpa.org

Valve Manufacturers Association of America

The Valve Manufacturers Association of America (VMA) is a trade association that represents the interests of nearly 100 North American manufacturers of valves, actuators and controls. Collectively, members account for approximately 80% of the total industrial valve shipments out of U.S. and Canadian facilities. Founded in 1938, VMA is headquartered in Washington, DC. Val-Matic regularly participates and contributes to VMA Conferences on Business Issues, Legislation, Marketing and Company Operations.

www.vma.org

Water and Sewer Distributors of America

The Water and Sewer Distributors of America (WASDA) is a national trade association comprised of distributors and manufacturers of waterworks and wastewater products whose mission is to strengthen and promote the distribution of water and wastewater products and services. Val-Matic is an associate member and regularly participates in annual conferences, committee meetings and the future leaders' council.

www.wasda.com

Water Environment Federation

The Water Environment Federation (WEF) is a leading technical organization for the water quality industry since 1928, whose mission is to connect water professionals; enrich the expertise of water professionals; increase the awareness of the impact and value of water; and provide a platform for water sector innovation. Val-Matic has been an active participant on several committees within the organization.

www.wef.org

Water and Wastewater Equipment Manufacturers Association
